intro: Spergularia tenuifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandspur, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, erect growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces clusters of pink or white flowers, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Spergularia tenuifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of poor soil conditions.
